byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

abstract: Egypt tries to restore informal cease-fire between Israel and Gaza after clashes between Israeli forces and militant group Palestinian Islamic Jihad lead to deaths of at least one Palestinian and an Israeli civilian; in separate development, Israeli court sentences former soldier Anat Kam to four and a half years in prison for stealing more than 2,000 classified documents and leaking them to newspaper reporter.
snippet: Tensions simmered as Egypt tried to restore an informal truce in Gaza and Israeli forces continued airstrikes in response to Palestinian rocket attacks.
lead_paragraph: Tensions simmered as Egypt tried to restore an informal truce in Gaza and Israeli forces continued airstrikes in response to Palestinian rocket attacks.

headline.main: After Attacks, Efforts to Restore Truce Between Israel and Groups in Gaza
headline.print_headline: After Attacks, Efforts to Restore Truce Between Israel and Groups in Gaza
headline.seo: After Attacks, Efforts to Restore Gaza Cease-Fire
